pageContext.analysis: Trump tweeted this over an image that said "50% approval rating." He appears to be citing a  poll for April 22-24 by Rasmussen, which consistently has a Republican-leaning bias. The polling gurus at FiveThirtyEight say that an adjusted rating would have shown Trump at 44 percent in the poll. On the day of the tweet, Trump had an average approval of 41.4 percent in 538's blended poll rating, along with 53.2 percent disapproval.
